item.title: Whaling emerges as major cybersecurity threat
item.description:
Whaling emerges as major cybersecurity threat

A clever variant of phishing scams is proliferating among enterprises, forcing CIOs to up their game even as they are still refining their cybersecurity practices to contend with various zero-day attacks. Called whaling, the social engineering grift typically involves a hacker masquerading as a senior executive asking an employee to transfer money.

item.title: Ossic headphones create 3D audio unique to you
item.description:
Ossic headphones create 3D audio unique to you

When you're wandering around in Jurassic Park and you hear a T-Rex roar, you run in the other direction. It's just good sense. No one wants to end their day - or their life - as an apex predator's lunch.

item.title: Techies Project by Photographer Helena Price
item.description:
Techies Project by Photographer Helena Price

The two words "Silicon Valley" immediately stir up stereotypes, stigma and maybe an HBO show. The name has become a cultural reflex, and that's what photographer Helena Price wants to change with her ambitious, large-scale portrait and interview series. Techies Project, launched today, is a collection of 100 in-depth interviews that breaks this idea of the "sameness" plaguing the area.

item.title: Headspace App Launches Personal Meditative Pods
item.description:
Headspace App Launches Personal Meditative Pods

More than five million people globally have used guided meditation service Headspace. There's an invaluable ease to using their service (especially the free app) and it has opened the doors of meditation to many. Now, the acclaimed team behind the app have produced a different sort of tool for meditation: a private nature-inspired pod made in collaboration with architect duo Oyler Wu.
